marklogic.body:
[dashmywig's ever-so-slightly-louche post yesterday was arbitrarily deleted without even the courtesy of a 'comment removed' notification; nevertheless, not being one to waste a good punchline, here he is again.]
''Now look here, Nick, this simply will not do. Yesterday I asked you to ginger up the Tabloid Telegraph Scare Story desk to invent a few more trite ways of saying there's a bit of dry weather and a possible hosepipe Ban: your response was a lame jest asking whether the coffee was on because you were parched. Later I sent you down to ramp up the panic level over Lyme's disease, only to be rewarded with a quip along the lines of your being there in a tick. Now is your chance to redeem yourself: there's a report just in by some pundit from Sussex University which, in a nutshell, claims that it is perfectly all right for what are rather amusingly called 'motorists' to stockpile petrol in case of a tanker strike. Now you will kindly go and monger a very great deal of scare.''
''I certainly would, Matt, except that your rollicking has given me the heebie-jeebies and made me break out in a Cold sweat, and I'm frightened that if I go down there I'll panic and lose my nerve.''
